oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Draughon Building, between 1907 and 1917
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A postcard of the Draughon Building in downtown Nashville, Tennessee. The 1930 Nashville City Directory lists their address at 124-126 8th Avenue North. The early 20th century postcard description reads: "Nashville, Tenn., home office of Draughon's Practical Business Colleges; established 1888; $300,000.00 capital; 31 Colleges in 17 States: Nashville, Washington, Atlanta, Austin, Columbia (S.C.), Dallas, Denison, El Paso, Evansville, Ft. Worth, Ft. Scott, Ft. Smith, Galveston, Houston, Jackson (Miss.), Jacksonville, Kansas City, Knoxville, Little Rock, Memphis, Montgomery, Muskogee, Oklahoma City, Paducah, Raleigh, St. Louis, San Antonio, Shreveport, Springfield (Mo.), Tyler, and Waco. Jno. F. Draughon, President." Forms part of the Nashville Room Postcard Collection. 1 postcard : col. ; 3.5 x 5.5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Draughon Practical Business College (Nashville, Tenn.)
